intro: Arnica operina, commonly known as mountain tobacco, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, lance-shaped leaves and a hairy stem. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to thrive in rocky and well-drained soils. Arnica operina is often used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
